{{also|Sein|s√©in}} ==English== ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{archaic spelling of|en|seine}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eins|EINs|NIEs|Nies|SINE|sien|sine|snie}} ---- ==Basque== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|eu|euq-pro|*seni}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{rfp|eu}} ===Noun=== {{eu-noun}} # [[child]] ---- ==Dutch== ===Pronunciation=== * {{rhymes|nl|…õiÃØn}} * {{IPA|nl|/s…õiÃØn/}} * {{audio|nl|nl-sein.ogg|sein (NL)}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{der|nl|fro|seigne}}, a northern variant of {{m|fro|signe}}, from {{der|nl|la|signum}}.''sein''; in [[w:Jan de Vries (linguist)|J. de Vries]] & F. de Tollenaere, "Etymologisch Woordenboek", Uitgeverij Het Spectrum, Utrecht, 1986 (14de druk) {{doublet|nl|zegen}}. ====Noun==== {{nl-noun|n|-en|seintje}} # [[signal]] #: {{syn|nl|signaal}} ===Etymology 2=== {{nonlemma}} ====Verb==== {{head|nl|verb form}} # {{nl-verb form of|p=1|n=sg|t=pres|m=ind|seinen}} # {{nl-verb form of|m=imp|seinen}} ===References=== ===Anagrams=== * {{l|nl|Ines}}, {{l|nl|nies}} ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|et|fiu-fin-pro|*saina}}, borrowed from a {{der|et|bat}} language, compare {{cog|lv|siena}}. {{cog|fi|sein√§}} is of the same origin. ===Pronunciation=== {{et-IPA}} ===Noun=== {{et-noun|seina|seina}} # [[wall]] ====Declension==== {{et-decl-hein|sein|seina}} ---- ==Finnish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{hyphenation|fi|sein}} * {{rhymes|fi|ein}} * {{fi-IPA}} ===Noun=== {{head|fi|noun form}} # {{fi-form of|case=genitive|pl=singular|sei}} # {{fi-form of|case=instructive|pl=plural|sei}} ===Noun=== {{head|fi|noun form}} # {{fi-form of|see|case=instructive|pl=plural}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|fi|a=eins|-isen|ensi|ensi-|ines|sine}} ---- ==French== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|fr|fro|sein}}, inherited from {{inh|fr|la|sinus}}, ultimately of {{der|fr|ine-pro|-}} origin. {{doublet|fr|sinus}}. Compare {{cog|it|seno}}, {{cog|ro|s√¢n}}, {{cog|rm|sain}}, {{cog|pt|seio}}, {{cog|es|seno}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{fr-IPA}} * {{audio|fr|Fr-sein.ogg|sein}} * {{homophones|fr|sain|sains|saint|saints|seing|seings|seins}} ===Noun=== {{fr-noun|m}} # {{lb|fr|anatomy}} [[breast]] #: ''sur votre jeune '''sein''' laissez rouler ma t√™te'' - let my head roll on your young breast # {{lb|fr|literary}} [[womb]] #: ''elle a port√© cet enfant dans son '''sein''' '' - she carried this child in her womb # [[bosom]] #: ''au '''sein''' de la famille '' - in the bosom of the family #: ''le '''sein''' du P√®re '' - the bosom of the Father ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|breast}} {{l|fr|poitrine}}, {{qualifier|Quebec|slang}} {{l|fr|boule}}, {{qualifier|slang}} {{l|fr|nichon}}, {{l|fr|nibard}}, {{l|fr|nib}}, {{qualifier|informal}} {{l|fr|t√©t√©}}, {{l|fr|lolo}}, {{l|fr|n√©n√©}}, {{l|fr|robert}}, {{qualifier|France|informal}} {{l|fr|gougoutte}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|fr|au sein de}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:TLFi}} ===Anagrams=== * {{l|fr|In√®s}}, {{l|fr|nies}}, {{l|fr|ni√©s}}, {{l|fr|sien}} ---- ==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de|dab=sein}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|seyn}} {{qualifier|obsolete}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/za…™ÃØn/}} * {{audio|de|De-sein.ogg}} * {{rhymes|de|a…™ÃØn}} * {{homophones|de|seinen}} {{a|according to a common pronunciation of this form}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{der|de|gmh|sein}}, {{m|gmh|sƒ´n}}, from {{der|de|goh|sƒ´n||to be}} (suppleted with {{der|de|gem-pro|*wesanƒÖ||to be}} and {{m|gem-pro|*beunƒÖ||to be, exist, become}}), from {{der|de|ine-pro|*es-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*h‚ÇÅes-||to be, exist}}. More at {{l|en|sooth}}. ====Verb==== {{de-verb-irregular|ist|war|gewesen|past subjunctive=w√§re|auxiliary=sein}} # {{lb|de|with a predicate adjective or predicate nominative}} to [[be]] #: {{uxi|de|Das '''ist''' sch√∂n.|That '''is''' beautiful.}} #: {{uxi|de|Das '''ist''' ein Auto.|That '''is''' a car.}} # {{lb|de|with a predicate adjective and an indirect object}} to [[feel]] {{gloss|to experience a certain condition}} #: {{uxi|de|Mir '''ist''' kalt.|I '''feel''' cold.|lit=To me '''is''' cold.}} #: {{uxi|de|Mir '''ist''' √ºbel.| I '''feel''' sick.}} #: {{uxi|de|Mir '''ist''' schwindelig.| I '''feel''' dizzy.}} #: {{uxi|de|Mir '''ist''' wohl.|I '''feel''' well.}} # {{lb|de|auxiliary}} {{non-gloss definition|forms the [[present perfect]] and [[past perfect]] tense of certain intransitive verbs}} #: {{uxi|de|Er '''ist''' alt geworden.|He '''has''' become old.}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[exist]]; [[there be|there to be]]; to be [[alive]] #: {{qualifier|a common proverb}} ''Was nicht '''ist''', kann noch werden.'' #:: That which does not '''exist''' now, may come into existence. #: {{ux|de|Wenn ich nicht mehr '''bin''', erbst du das Haus.|When I '''am''' no more, you'll inherit the house.}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|colloquial}} to have the next [[turn]] (in a game, in a queue, etc.) #: {{uxi|de|Du '''bist'''.|It‚Äôs your turn.}} #: {{uxi|de|Du '''bist''' nach mir.|Your turn is after mine.}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|child language}} to [[be]] "[[it]]"; to [[be]] the [[tagger]] in a game of [[tag]] #: {{uxi|de|Du '''bist'''!| You're '''it'''!}} #: {{uxi|de|Ich '''bin''' nicht mehr.|I''''m''' not '''it''' anymore.}} =====Conjugation===== {{de-conj-auto|sein|aux=s}} Alternative forms: * ''Past participle'': {{l|de|gewest}} {{qualifier|obsolete; poetical}} * ''Second-person plural preterite indicative'': {{l|de|waret}} {{qualifier|older; poetical}} * ''Second-person singular subjunctive II'': {{l|de|w√§rst}} * ''Second-person plural subjunctive II'': {{l|de|w√§rt}} The subjunctive I (first and third person) and indicative (first person only) forms are also used as imperatives. * {{ux|de|'''Seien''' wir mal ehrlich./'''Sind''' wir mal ehrlich.|'''Let'''‚Äôs '''be''' honest.|inline=1}} * {{ux|de|{{q|second-person formal}} '''Seien''' Sie mal ehrlich.|'''Be''' honest!|inline=1}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|de|da sein}} * {{l|de|weg sein}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|de|gmh|sein}}, {{m|gmh|sƒ´n}}, from {{inh|de|goh|sƒ´n}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*sƒ´naz||his own, her own, its own, their own}} (a reflexive possessive), from genitive of {{inh|de|ine-pro|*sw√©}} with denominative suffix {{inh|de|ine-pro|*-n√≥s}}, equivalent to the genitive form of {{cog|gem-pro|*se-}}. [[his]] # [[its]] {{q|agreeing with a neuter or masculine noun}} # [[one's]] #: {{ux|de|Man muss '''seinem''' Herzen folgen.|One must follow one‚Äôs heart.}} =====Usage notes===== When used as a pronoun, the nominative masculine takes the form {{m|de|seiner}}, and the nominative/accusative neuter takes the form {{m|de|seines}} or {{m|de|seins}}. * {{uxi|de|mein Vater und '''seiner'''|my father and his}} * {{uxi|de|mein Kind und '''sein(e)s'''|my child and his}} =====Inflection===== {{de-decl-sein}} =====See also===== {{de-possessive pronouns}} ====Determiner==== {{head|de|determiner form}} #
